intro: Hemsleya chinensis var. ningnanensis, commonly known as the Ningnan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and is known for its ornamental value. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
